page.title: 19CAVING ON THE MENDIPS
page.content: Caving in the Mendips started seriously about 80 years ago. There are not many caves in the area of this map but there are many on the Mendips, for example around Wookey, Cheddar and Priddy. The caves have been formed as the soft limestone rock has been worn away by underground streams and rivers. The few caves in this particular area are Attborough Swallet 561,519. Mine 4118 537,529. Mine 4117 537,539. Willets Lane Hole 588,529. Nedge Hole 592,508. Lily Combe Hole 582,536. Greendown Farm Mine Shaft 574,538. Cavers may also wish to visit many other caves in the Wookey, Priddy and Cheddar areas.
